title: Generic Pattern
description: Generic security pattern that shows how the major NIST control families apply to security architecture for generic computing environment

content.assumptions: All computing systems are accessed from some form of user interface to a client. The client can connect to resources provided by a host across some form of network. Hosts can act as clients and servers to communicate. This model echoes the original design goals of TCP/IP where the intelligence is placed into the end point, and application layer of the network stack, and the network simply transfers data packets.
